info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 7:58PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF SOUTHERN WAYNE...SUSQUEHANNA... NORTHERN WAYNE...BRADFORD...AND LACKAWANNA COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of 30 MPH and greater can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. Brief periods of heavy snow can be expected as the squall moves through the area. Blowing snow can also quickly limit visibility. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 755 PM EST, a snow squall was along a line extending from near Equinunk to Pleasant Mount to near Montrose to Litchfield and moving southeast at 15 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Carbondale, Honesdale, Rush, Jackson, Clifford, Forest City, Mayfield, Springville, Montrose and Dimock. This includes the following highway exits... Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 201 and 223. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
